channel.title: Education News
channel.description: A RSS feed containing the latest education related news from NASA.

item.title: NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station to Answer Questions from High School Students
item.description: NASA astronaut Chris Cassidy, currently aboard the International Space Station, will answer questions posed by high school students from across the nation this week.

item.title: NASA Goddard’s First Virtual Interns Reflect on Their Summer Experience
item.description: Interns who successfully worked in Goddard's first all-virtual internship share their experiences.

item.title: Space Grant Embarks Upon Exciting Program-Level Evaluation Pilot
item.description: The purpose of these awards will be to pilot an approach over the next 2 years to assess the degree by which the Space Grant goals, and objectives have been met across the Program’s implementation.

item.title: NASA Awards Grants to Minority Serving Institutions to Improve Participation in Engineering
item.description: NASA has awarded 14 planning grants to Minority Serving Institutions (MSIs) through its Minority University Research and Education Project (MUREP), part of the agency’s Office of STEM Engagement.

item.title: Making the Most of a Virtual NASA Internship
item.description: To maintain steady progress with projects, NASA Langley decided to allow their interns to work remotely from their residences. Many of these interns work on important upcoming missions.

item.title: NASA Awards Fellowships to Advance Exploration, Increase Minority STEM Opportunities
item.description: NASA has awarded 17 fellowships to minority-serving institutions, through its Minority University Research and Education Project (MUREP), and an additional five fellowships to other universities through mission directorate project funds.

item.title: Langley CARES Volunteers Give Local STEM Students Virtual Tutoring
item.description: The aim of Langley CARES, or Community Alliance to Reinforce Education in STEM, is to empower the next generation of the NASA workforce in the Hampton Roads community.

item.title: Aviation Scholars to Speak with NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
item.description: Aviation scholars from across the nation will pose questions next week to NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

item.title: Alabama High School Students Create a Meal NASA Will Send to Astronauts in Space
item.description: To add variety to the healthy diet of the astronauts on the International Space Station, NASA’s HUNCH program, which stands for High school students United with NASA to Create Hardware, created a culinary competition five years ago to involve high school students in the creation of new recipes to feed the astronauts on the station.

item.title: Artemis Generation Students Across US to Speak with NASA Astronaut in Space
item.description: Students from across the nation will pose questions about NASA’s Artemis program to an astronaut aboard the International Space Station. The educational event will air live at 12:15 p.m. EDT Thursday, July 9, on NASA Television and the agency’s website.
